data.fullContent: All human languages, even spontaneous ones, show many common principles of language acquisition as well as rules of grammar. The concept of universal grammar proposes that this is due to a set of innate rules, which guide how we acquire language and how we construct valid sentences in it. It thus attempts to explain language in general, and not simply describe the construction of any one specific language per se.
data.answer: 所有的人类语言，即使是自发的语言，都表现出许多共同的语言习得原则和语法规则。普遍语法的概念认为，这是由于一套固有的规则，指导我们如何习得语言和如何用它构建有效的句子。因此，它试图从总体上解释语言，而不是简单地描述任何一种特定语言本身的结构。
